title: can anyone id this
content:
can anyone id the broadway font or any of these fonts for that matter???

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [photo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090404045624/http:/typophile.com/files/photo_8.jpg) | 152.57 KB |

 [‹ rounded sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20090404045624/http:/typophile.com/node/56589 "Go to previous forum topic") [Lithuanian newspaper ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20090404045624/http:/typophile.com/node/56587 "Go to next forum topic")
author: doji09

comments.content: thanks to anyone who can help.

All of that lettering is probably hand-painted. Seems that the two A’s in BROADWAY are a bit different (look at the counters). However, you can find similar styles at [Letterhead Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20090404045624/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/), as those guys are lettering artists too.

- Mike Yanega
